content:
Hey, I wanted to open up a topic about the "async reading club" format. I like the "reading/discussing" parts; but admittedly I felt a bit overwhelmed during the "discussion" section. Most definitely because I was the author of the post discussed.

But I was wondering if maybe there was appetite to try and do this over a sync call next time instead? I feel that would've made the discussion part of it easier to manage.
I'd be up for trying that. There were parts of the discussion where I felt like having extra queues to tell who was in the process of responding would have been helpful.
Although in general I'm surprised at how much I like text meetings.
I'd be up for a call, I wouldn't be able to do the current time for the next three weeks though
I think we should try to read in advance too
I don't want to read in advance, because I maintain nobody will do it
I'm also not sure if I want calls, because I have so many in my life
and because it makes it less accessible
that said, I agree that the conversation didn't feel very useful
and calls can sometimes be better when there's amorphous structure
anyway, I think it's worth trying a call format
and we can decide which seems to be working better

nikomatsakis said:

I don't want to read in advance, because I maintain nobody will do it

I guess a downside is that 45 minutes is a bit tight, too, often calls where you read something substantial might use the first 30 minutes to read

the "read at meeting" model requires the documents be written with that consumption model in mind at time of authorship. Do you think that's the case for the posts that are the topic of the reading club?
(Most blogs posts typically are quickly digestable, but not always.)
